Answer: In theory it was one of the earliest versions to automatically incorporate speed and direction plus other factors into the sighting, along with an autopilot function that would make small corrections during the terminal phase of the bombing run.In reality, the features had already been leaked to the Germans even before the war started, and in practice the bombsight just didn’t deliver even close to they hype. It was a good idea pushed by an even better snake oil salesman. The USAAF ended up relying on the first bombers bomb impact points and the US Navy heavily depended on dive bombing.
